website_summaries.verdict: One of the best ice cream makers of the brand, this premium model is equipped with commercial-quality features.
pros: Includes a paddle for gelato and a separate paddle for ice cream
Keeps ice cream cool even 10 minutes after the machine has finished
cons: Many buyers had issues with the customer service offered by the manufacturer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working after two uses and Cuisinart was slow to respond and, after many efforts to contact them, told me I would have to ship it back at my own expense and pay shipping and handling on the replacement unit
customer_reviews.author: John M Wray

customer_reviews.title: Warranty does not cover shipping.  If your appliance goes out, you pay shipping!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the ice cream maker and used it 3 times. It quit working and they sent me a replacement. When I tried to ship the defective one back to Cuisinart, I was told that the warranty does not cover shipping!! I have many Cuisinart appliances in my kitchen. However, I WILL NOT BE PURCHASING ANYMORE APPLIANCES FROM CUISINART!!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Alexander

customer_reviews.title: First batch fail
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this product! Ice cream is my fovorite food! So my first attempt was with simple vanilla. I followed instructions in the Cuisinart users guide. The paddle stopped moving at around 45 minutes. The ice cream was frozen around the edges and in the middle it was like soup. I have grand kids coming from back east that are looming forward to making their own ice cream. Also the other reviews mention just putting the mix straight in to the container. The instructions s called for placing mixture in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. I’m confused. I hope you can help me. I called a technician... no answer. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: The BEST available - a terrific value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old similar ice cream maker with built-in freezer by another company. This Cuisinart ICE-100 is superior in every way, the processing container lifts out easily to remove the completed ice cream or gelato, and has different processing blades for both which means they process them quickly and efficiently. It is much quieter than my older model and it is easier to set up and clean. The first batch I made was Carrie Brown's low carb double chocolate hazelnut ice cream and it was so incredibly good I know we will be using this machine on a weekly basis and loving it! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Craig B. Highberger

customer_reviews.title: LOUD TERRIBLE SOUNDING  MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: Loudest ice cream gelato machine Ever purchased. Obnoxiously loud. As the motor runs consistently for at least 50 min. Terrible distraction. Next, this almost 200$ machine takes up a lot of space! Approx. 1 ft by 17" long it's heavy and on top of all that, directions read as followed: hand mix all in separate bowls then moving products to 2 bowl. Cleaning by hand ONLY! Not Dishwasher safe. Just not worth the price. Cuisanart...we would like to have a nearly / to quiet motor compressor and with it being so large it should at least mix all ingredients in original 'Anodized Aluminum Mixing Bowl' hence the word "Mixing" & without the use of prior refrigeration over night to chill...
customer_reviews.author: LuminousStarFish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with excellent results.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, excellent product. Made several batches of the best ice cream and gellato. Average batch processing time (1+qt) substantially less than recipe suggests (my times 25-30 min vs. 50 min). Mixing paddles are difficult (read: messy) to scrape off, even with silicone spatulas. With the application of a little common-sense, exceptional results can be obtained. I experienced *none* of the common complaints of bucket freezing in place, drive train noise, etc. - the machine is smooth and (relatively) quiet. The machine is the level of quality i would expect from Cuisinart. Nice companion product is the SUMO insulated ice cream containers...
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Ice cream has NEVER set!
customer_reviews.text: I have to wonder what I am doing wrong. I have made home made ice cream for years with the cheap o $20 ones where you need ice cream salt and a motor churns it in a bucket of freezing water. Using this Cuisinart ICE-100 $300 unit, in 6 attempts following the Cuisinart recipe and instruction to the letter the ice cream has not set once! I have to pour it out after letting it run for as long as 1.5 hours and let it freeze in the freezer. I could do that myself and skip this $300 piece of junk. Any ideas?
customer_reviews.author: Damien G.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but, not sure it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. It's very easy to make ice cream. If any ice cream seeps out of the bucket then you're in trouble. It's not easy to clean if the bucket overflows. It can get ice cream in tiny little slots which seem as though the designer never thought someone would need to clean there. I've also had many problems with the bucket freezing to the unit. No matter how much I clean, how dry it is, the bowl always freezes to the machine. It makes good ice cream and it's very easy to use; it's just a huge pain if your recipe over-fluffs beyond the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: The first time I used it everything went smoothly. Then, the next two times the paddle stopped half way through. I had to clean the bucket out and put the mixture back in so that the paddle can move. Ever since however it has been working smoothly. I therefore changed my rating from 2 to 4. There is no comparison in this gelato/ice cream vs store bought. And when working smoothly it is a snap to use especially for recipes that don't need to be heated up and then cooled in the refrigerator before being put in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: brick house

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying making Frozen Yogurts
customer_reviews.text: After making one ice cream recipe I felt too guilty to ever make it again since it's a lot of cream... so instead I experimented throwing in one of those Kefir yogurts that you can drink. Plain, with vanilla bean and vanilla extract and some almond milk and OH MY! It's perfect. It's not creamy but freezes well enough and thaws nicely in microwave for a delicious dessert. The machine is AMAZING. Very fast, and does the job so well. It's at a noise level I can tolerate to a degree... but I like putting it outside on the balcony. I'm happy I splurged on the compressor since I make 2 batches in a row.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Ziel

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Unit works like a charm. Only been using it for about two weeks now. Flavor depends really on what you put inside but it’s easy to use. Power it on, determine how many minutes you want and start. In 45 minutes you have ice cream. If you want to add walnuts., fudge or what ever your fancy may be, I found it best to wait until the very last minute other wise it will just blend it in. So vanilla ice cream will quickly turn to Chocolate if you mix it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful setting the cannister in the unit properly - then it works great
customer_reviews.text: I had given this a low review because it seemed that the motor stopped turning too soon. However, after a few attempts I finally realized that I had not pressed the cannister in the compressor unit properly. This time I made sure it was secured in place properly and then it worked like a charm. Now I'm very happy with it. The compressor works very fast, making ice cream or gelato in about 45 minutes from refrigerator-cooled ingredients. So - easy to set up, fast to make, and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Marco P

customer_reviews.title: Makes great ice cream!
customer_reviews.text: It works great. My only complaint is the rim where the lid attaches is connected to the machine and you can't take it out to clean. It always gets a little bit of ice cream stuck in the cracks and you can't get it out. I use Q-Tips, toothpicks and rinse to get it clean. Total pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: Svenska

customer_reviews.title: First time owner. Never buying store brands again!
customer_reviews.text: First Ice Cream Maker we have ever owned. We have used it about a dozen times for both 'standard' and custard based ice creams and have loved every bite. About half the recipes we made were right from the book that came with the machine. The other half from various online sources. All have turned out great. We are lazy and don't prefreeze the bucket. We don't re-cool the ingredients for regular ice cream (of course we do cool the cooked based...but maybe not to the extend recommended) but still get a creamy delicious result in no more than 45 minutes! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: A superior ice cream machine
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker is really good. The ice cream has a very smooth texture especially if one uses cooked custard. The flavors are limitless as I found because I like to experiment. I made a chocolate mint ice cream using the basic cooked custard recipe but used fresh cut mint from my garden. I simply cut some mint and added it to the custard during cooking, then let it cool in the mix, straining it out before placing in the ice cream maker. I added the chocolate as thin ribbons about half way through the hour spent in the ice cream machine. It is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: I love ice cream and this product makes good ice cream
customer_reviews.text: I love ice cream and this product makes good ice cream. Quickly. It is big and heavy so it takes up counter space. But it does a good job. It's a little difficult to clean up so I knocked off one star for that. Or, maybe it was for the additional ten pounds I put on as the result of buying it. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for families, super easy!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this ice cream maker. We use it all the time. Very easy and efficient. Delicious ice cream every time. I’d love it to make more in each batch, but I guess the cooling element can only handle a relatively small amount. Cleaning is easy, but my only complaint (and I’m sure it’s the same for every type of ice cream maker) is that it’s difficult to get all the wonderful ice cream off the paddle. It seems as though as much as 25% is left on the paddle and left over for some lucky person to lick it off. Challenging to get it off otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Documentation is a bit unclear but overall a nice machine
customer_reviews.text: Works quickly and easily. As far as switching from the mixing cycle to the cooling cycle before the time set has expired, there seems to be no way to do that. I talked to the tech folks on the phone and the first two people could not comprehend the issue. But, it's a great machine for a nice price with a long guarantee that hopefully will not be needed as warranties are pretty much a massive inconvenience with packing and shipping. There are some cheaper materials used in construction but at this price that is to be expected. The Breville may be a better engineered unit but it is quite a bit more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: MvC3 Fan

customer_reviews.title: Machine was damaged before use due to voltage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ice cream maker from Singapore. I didn't know the machine is made under USA voltage, 120V. Before I use, the machine immediately got short circuit and I can't use anymore. I was so disappointed. I tried to search the seller to contact for replacement, but I couldn't find.
customer_reviews.author: YUKO

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice cream maker. It's so easy to use and I love that I dont have to freeze the bucket thing beforehand. It's super easy to clean and it's cool that it comes with a recipe booklet. So far I've made vanilla bean custard, dark chocolate custard, pistachio gelato, lemon sorbet, green tea ice cream, berry sorbet, and even a meal replacement ice cream snack. I'm so happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: CheffyChic

customer_reviews.title: I'm now a Gelato Master
customer_reviews.text: After visiting Italy and falling in love with great Gelato, I bought this to make my own Gelato using the "Ciao Bella" recipe book. The recipes in the book are perfectly portioned for the Cuisinart ICE-100! I've made lots of flavors as well a Sorbets. Very easy to use once you get going. 1. Plug in and Turn on, 2. Set Time 3. Go! I found that 40 minutes works great for Gelato. I swear, homemade Gelato beats out Store Bought by a mile and is even better than the best Gelato I had in Italy! No preservatives - just goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Average Guy

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: I received a defective product. The compressor never froze the mixture. Big disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ice cream churn.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent ice cream maker. First churn was perfect in 40 minutes. Consistancy is somewhere between soft serve and and hand dipped. Avoiding clean up is just a matter of not overfilling. The noise level did not bother us sitting a few feet away. Having the ability to make creamy, keto friendly ice cream, when we want it, is monumental for us! It is heavy due to the compressor, but not unmanageable. Due to size, you would probably not want to leave it out on your kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present for my husband
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my kitchen averse husband as a gift. It sat for several weeks until he got over his reluctance to try it out. But, once he tasted that first batch he turned into the ice cream making guru! He has learned many tricks of cooking and now has confidence to try new recipes. He is even making up some of his own. I may have created a monster. Now, if I can introduce him to making dinners......
customer_reviews.author: Happy iPad User

customer_reviews.title: Great ice cream machine!
customer_reviews.text: This makes wonderful ice creams, like the ones you buy in a real home made gelato shop. Also worked well with yoghurt. I could give more stars for the quality of the ice cream you get with it. The only cons is that you cannot make enough amount each time. We are four and to have a regular portion for each we have to go twice with the process. The machine is kind of big, it could have had a bigger capacity. But still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Estela Quintana Livingston

customer_reviews.title: If you like ice cream you will like how quick an easy this one is
customer_reviews.text: Me an my girl tried this out the first time we made the vanilla ice cream with came out awesome even tho we may have added to much cause it over flowed out the lid an we made Mountain Dew ice cream an that over flowed out the lid. But for the third batch we made peppermint Patti mini ice cream an cut the cream an milk by a quarter cup each for a half cup total an we did it right no over flow
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: It works well, but takes longer to make ice cream that instructions say
customer_reviews.text: I like this machine and feel it is worth the price, assuming it keeps working. Given some of the reviews, that may be in question. We will see. My experience so far is that it takes twice as long to freeze ice cream than the instructions say it will, but it does get there. Unlike my experience with a Cuisinart pre-frozen tub type ice cream maker, which never seemed to get the product frozen. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream unit has been on my wish list for several years. I’m so happy to finally get and use it. From Grapefruit so-bet to Lemon Gelato. Easy to use and store.
customer_reviews.author: Lenslady1

customer_reviews.title: Make good memories AND delicious ice cream!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 69-year old guy and my 3-year old granddaughter and I made delicious cream in 45 minutes from start to finish! It was sooooo easy. Who needs Ben and Jerry's?!?! What a bargin!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alan of Maine

customer_reviews.title: Superchurner
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford this and make ice cream often you really must buy this. I went from a hamilton beach freeze the drum one batch at a time to this. It is great, no waiting. You can even churn a batch from hot to ice cream in less than an hour and then just keep going. I wish the capacity was bigger but I just do batches, no need to stop in between and once it's at temperature the second and third batched go even faster.
customer_reviews.author: Ni518079

customer_reviews.title: The best home ice cream machine I have found
customer_reviews.text: Never had any issues with this it was definitely easy to make multiple batches. In the time that it takes you to transfer the material into your storage container wash and rinse all parts it's cooled off enough to pour in your mix and start the next batch. I wished it would have made more than a quart and a half but it did its job. You can pour pretty much anything in up to the fill line and it will freeze it and turned it into a delicious Frozen treat
customer_reviews.author: Cousin D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Our new toy is terrific. We made our first ice cream last night. We made a full recipe of ingredients and the finished product tried climbing out of the machine. Recommend using half a recipe to prevent climbing. I'm not complaining because I was the one who got to clean the paddle and eat the ice cream.😊
customer_reviews.author: Texas Gurl

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Be careful to insure that the container is anchored in the slot correctly or the auger will lift and not turn. Does great with gelato!
customer_reviews.author: Consejero

customer_reviews.title: Nice appliance
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream maker is awesome. It churns a product just like commercial ice cream but with my ingredients---with no additives, low sugar, etc. I can use alternative milk products like coconut milk or oat milk to serve to my lactose sensitive friends. Also does sorbet. Love it. It is a bit heavy, and does take up quite a bit of space in my cupboard, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wermuth

customer_reviews.title: So simple and so good.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for about 2 years now and this incorporates the best of all worlds. It is so simple to use, so simple to clean. I purchased this because I went on a Keto diet and still wanted my ice cream. Whats great about it is that you dont have to prefreeze the bowl and you can do multiple loads. Its also fun to just try different recipes and make up your own. Awesome does not do it credit.
customer_reviews.author: Rich M

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Last year I bought a $60 Cuisinart ice cream maker and ended up returning it after one use because the bowl would not get cold enough to have the ice cream freeze. So this Christmas, I bought this much more expensive ice cream maker and it is well worth it! I have made over 15 batches of ice cream so far. All very easy, quick and delicious. This machine has a compressor, which eliminates the problem the other ice cream makers have since you do not need to freeze the bowl. Easy to clean and make and experiment with ice cream flavors. No complaints, it does what is says very well!
customer_reviews.author: A. H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Appliance in my Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice cream maker. It is so simple, with no mess and no fuss. Make a recipe and refrigerate it at least 2 hours. I make the recipe in the evening and make the ice cream the next morning. Put the mixture in the container, turn the machine on, and that’s it. I love love love it.
customer_reviews.author: HCB

customer_reviews.title: a little noisy but otherwise perfect
customer_reviews.text: i have always wanted on of these and finally the price came to a point that i could afford it. i make a quart and it filled up the pot after churning so i'm wondering if the extra half it is supposed to hold would fit. its noisy and heavy so it will live in the garage but 40 minutes and its done. first trial was ginger ice cream made with more half and half than cream and can't wait to try butter pecan next!
customer_reviews.author: Magnamosa

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC! Ice Cream Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I just got my machine a few weeks ago and have made several cookies n cream, peanut butter/Reese's ice cream, strawberry ice cream and they all turned out super delicious! I added 1-2 egg yolks into the mixture and that makes it creamy like store bought but w/out all the fillers and chemicals! This machine is capable of making one batch after the other and not overheating etc. I recommend this machine for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Hill

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase I have made! I have made everything from cookies and cream ice cream to strawberry frozen yogurt. It’s great with subs too like almond and oat milk. If you’re wanting to make normal decadent ice creams or healthy alternatives you can do both. I promise the price is worth it. I was between this and the breville and this has met all my needs while being lower priced. You will not regret it! You can easily gift ice cream to friends and they will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: One worked, one didn't
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for my son and one for myself. Mine worked wonderfully. I've had it a month and have made 5 batches of ice cream already! But, my son's was dead on arrival. It cooled, but didn't spin. He didn't try to use it until a month after he received it, so the window to return to Amazon was lapsed. Hoping Cuisinart can come to the rescue. I would have given it 5 stars, except one simply didn't work. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Myers

customer_reviews.title: Its awesome. Having fun making my own icecream.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this thing is great. Its not too expensive for making ice-cream and you don't need to go and drive to get ice or something. Cleanup is super easy. Literally just wipe it away. I have used it for 6 batches so far. Its awesome. I would recommend pre chilling the vessel by turning it on for a bit, and pre chilling your cream.
customer_reviews.author: Heart

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing, only issue is that you are limited to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing, only issue is that you are limited to about a quart maybe a bit less. If you exceed that amount as it turns to ice cream it pushes a bit of liquid out and it seeps down between the bucket and the sidewalls and freezes the bucket in place making it difficult to remove the bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t get cold enough. The churning doesn’t work well. Large part of the batch just spins around on the surface and never cools down.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Miles

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Great ice cream maker. I have a weakness for ice cream and was never a fan of most homemade ice cream makers. This is my favorite buy as of late. Great ice cream recipes and yummy ice cream. Easy to clean! So glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Rasey

customer_reviews.title: Makes awesome ice cream!
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying trying out different ice cream flavors and recipes. So far... delicious creamy peanut butter, strawberry, chocolate, and of course vanilla. Easy to clean. Definitely don't overfill above max line. Only thing we're trying to master is the best way to clean the ice cream off the beater, but we will persevere.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia A. Ogle

customer_reviews.title: Great ice cream/gelato maker!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great ice cream/ gelato machine! We previously had an old one that you had to add ice to. It is much faster and quieter than our old machine. The only drawback is that it is fairly heavy as it has its own compressor but you can expect that. It's one awesome machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ice Cream
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I purchase this ice cream maker sooner? So easy to use and clean. Makes homemade ice cream in about an hour. I grew up with the wooden crank machine that needed ice and salt. This machine produces the same quality product but without all the fuss. I just love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Luca

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and it works.
customer_reviews.text: My gf always wants custom ice cream and the ice cream maker we had was a constant hassle to use. The idea of being able to make desert without having to buy salt and ice, and not deal with the constant checks the other cheaper options have was a dream. This is expensive, but you can make ice cream and desert how you want with the ingredients you want.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Works well but noisier than expected.
customer_reviews.text: As an ice cream maker it works well but it is noisier than expected. I would say that it is just as noisy as my off brand ice cream maker. The compressor is quiet. The motor for turning the paddle to mix the ice cream while it is freezing is very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy Who Reviews Things

customer_reviews.title: Makes delicious ice cream. Good in, GREAT out!
customer_reviews.text: Love it when the family gets together to make homemade ice cream. I just wish it produced more than 1-1/2 quarts at a time though. It’s fun to come up with different flavor ideas. I rated the ease of clean-up a little lower because oh my goodness...THAT is a chore to get this thing clean, but maybe it’s just me. Still very well worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Hines

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and maintain. If you want to make lots of ice cream and/or you're prone to forgetting to freeze a canister on manual models, this is for you. My only small complaint is that it doesn't make enough in 1 batch. But that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: David S. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Big overrun on the machine
customer_reviews.text: I have produced 4 batches in the 3 days I have had this. I have used 3 different base recipes that are all based on 1 quart. The overrun on this machine is a major issue. I have had it coming out of the top which makes cleaning the machine a nightmare. I have tried both paddles, ice cream and gelato and they both overrun. Keep this in mind as you may want to cut your recipes by a quarter. Now for the good, it produces larger batches, nice overrun and a great texture. It freezes very quickly. I make the recipe and refrigerate it for an hour or so before starting the machine, has worked great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great ice cream
customer_reviews.text: works great, be aware of adding more ingredients to it because it makes it full just with the recipe amount when it stirs up to form the ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great machine to have
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine for making my keto icecream! I did have one of the first models of these, it worked ok but not great, this upgrade was so worth the money. It works great! I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase! So much better than the old style ice cream makers. Ice cream is done in about 35 minutes. Used the recipes in the accompanying book. Tasty and creamy. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: susan i moore

customer_reviews.title: Makes really good ice cream
customer_reviews.text: This ice cream machine makes really good ice cream. The texture is soft and fluffy when using milk as a base. I haven't found a vegan recipe that works well yet but I am sure once I find a good recipe it will make some delicious ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I've owned other types of ice cream makers throughout the years and this one simplifies things greatly. No ice and salt to use, no bowl to freeze, just put your ingredients in and press start. Usually takes less than the recommended one hour mixing time. We've been averaging about 40 minutes. Makes about 4 servings per batch. Slightly difficult to get all the ice cream off the dasher and out of the bowl, a small rubber spatula is very helpful. Couldn't be happier with the product. Cusinart always makes high quality items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've made so much ice cream with this already and had lots of fun trying different types of recipes. I LOVE being in control of the ingredients in my ice cream and knowing exactly where they came from. The cooling cycle is quick and I've been able to do back to back batches without any trouble. The machine is a little loud so I keep it in my arctic entry and shut the door while it's my delicious frozen desserts. The best part about this machine is that it has an auto-shutoff feature if the ice cream gets too cold and hard. This means the motor is less likely to burn out.
customer_reviews.author: Christen Bouffard

customer_reviews.title: Compressor Ice Cream Maker Promote Frequent Ice Cream Making
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart ICE-100 Compressor ice cream maker is so quick and so much quieter than my old motorized tub maker, and doesn't need the mess of salt and ice. That cuts out the major irritation to making ice cream. My first batch was Bi-Rite Creamery of SanFrancisco's "Salted Caramel" recipe - what a wonderful combination of flavors! This really increases my enthusiasm for ice cream making, and I have already picked out four more recipes from the same Creamery cook book to try. You won't regret having this ice cream maker - I promise. And I still have to try the gelato paddle, which will probably increase my ice cream making even more.
customer_reviews.author: Gretel Pyr

customer_reviews.title: Is good!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and even they say the ice cream is still soft after it was done mixing i thought it was perfect to have a quick taste after mixing before putting in freezer. Just like store bought i should have ordered the larger model
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hodgdon

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This machine made ice cream that was fantastic. Not icy like old fashioned machines. It makes fantastic Gelato too. Also, it has a neat feature that is a "keep cold" or "hold" feature so that when it is finished making the ice cream it keeps it cold until you are ready to use it. I put it on at the beginning of a dinner party and then the ice cream is waiting there for me at the end of the meal, being kept cold automatically. Much better quality than I expected for the price. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Rancho Guy 4

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an option to the old ice and salt way of making ice cream. I did some research on self-contained refrigerated models and settled on the Cusinart ICE 100. It was a bit pricy, but it is well worth the price. I have been making ice cream commercially for over 50 years and this machine made some of the best ice cream I've ever made. Sorbets, gelatos and ice cream were a breeze with this machine. If you have any doubts about the refrigerated models, believe me they are well worth it. Then you can get rid of the old ice and salt machine at a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin J. Griggs

customer_reviews.title: The price was not as good as last time
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was on time! The price was not as good as last time, up more than 20%! The product usually presents problems with one year of use, that is, it is a low quality product in normal use! Here in Brazil, they do not accept to repair the product because it was bought in the USA, it would be advisable for the manufacturer to get another partner here in Brazil, to cover technical assistance regarding the brand and not where the product was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellet
customer_reviews.text: So glad I finally splurged, great for summer treats.. I've cream, fro-yo, margaritas?!? I bought this model based on David lebovitz recommendations and match, it does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: elyse

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what you want
customer_reviews.text: Makes ice cream in less than an hour with a push of a button! Easy start, no preparations other than making your mixture prior to pouring it into the machine's pot hot or cold. Literally says 1qt-1 1/2qt and doesnt spill whatsoever. Whoever has spillage clearly is using too much mixture. Cleanup is one rice cooker pot and a plastic mixer, that is all.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The best ice cream maker around!
customer_reviews.text: This Cuisinart ice cream maker is the best - having had the earlier versions where you have to freeze the bowl - this one is MUCH more user friendly - just add ingredients and start the machine - viola! - instantly delicious ice cream. Wonderful purchase - expensive but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: What can I tell you? I love ice cream, especially ice cream without all of the preservatives found in most commercially manufactured ice cream. It is very easy to use with Cuisinart excellence. We merely prepare a fresh batch of ice cream with the flavor of our choice each afternoon and it is ready for our desert after dinner. Or if friends drop over we can have a fresh batch of ice cream in about 35 minutes for all of us to enjoy. If you love ice cream then this is the unit to purchase. It also comes with a three year limited warranty. I might add that it is fun to experiment with various flavors and dairy products.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Hiker

customer_reviews.title: We just love this machine!!
customer_reviews.text: In my quest to make and eat food with out preservatives and chemicals I decided to give homemade ice cream a try. I ordered the Cuisinart ICE-100 on Thursday and it arrived this Saturday morning. Today I made Kefir ice cream with this machine and it turned out wonderful! Creamy and delicious! The process was quick and easy. The instructions and recipes that came with the machine were clear. This is my first Ice Cream maker and I am impressed in the quality and how quiet it is. I whole heartily recommend this machine! Get one you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Terrafirma

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Using it thru a 240v step down transformer. Thought a 500watt would do but it kept tripping so now have a 1,000watt and that works well. Highly recommend this product. Worth the price. 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Great for keto icecream.
customer_reviews.text: Love this icecream maker. Have used it 4 times a week and runs perfect. Keto icecream finally.
customer_reviews.author: betty greenlee

customer_reviews.title: Busted from first use
customer_reviews.text: My ice cream maker busted from first use, you should've wrote in the specs that it's 120v, it was not written anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: M.M

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for over a year. I make ice cream or sherbet at least once a week. I love it. My only disappointment is the opening in the lid which is plastic is broken and because cuisinart no longer supports this model I can't get a replacement part. Any ideas cuisinart?
customer_reviews.author: C. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this icecream maker my only complaint is my husband ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this icecream maker my only complaint is my husband has put on a bit of weight since we bought it. He makes regular icecream and I make my own keto version! Its so easy to use. My husband and I have several things we always say is best purchase ever...this is one of them
customer_reviews.author: Harry and Jamie Narainen

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, quick creamy ice cream maker
customer_reviews.text: We love our new ice cream maker! I had to turn the box upside down to remove the machine, so I had to let it sit flat on the counter for a day before using it. It's easy to operate, easy to clean, and makes the best ice cream we have ever had! It's best not to use more than 4.5 cups of ice cream mix, so it wont overfill and hit the lid. Its quiet and fits nicely on our counter. Very happy and satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Delicious!  Makes back to back batches!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love it!! It is very easy to use. Nothing to pre-freeze. No ice or ice cream salt needed. Just plug it in and go! We have already made three batches of ice cream: Vanilla Bean, Banana Rum, and Strawberry. We mixed the ingredients the night before as instructed. The ice cream is smooth, creamy, and not too soft. The lid is designed with a smaller lid to make it easy to add in chocolate chips, sprinkles, crushed cookies, etc. while the ice cream is mixing. We can't wait to try gelato next!
customer_reviews.author: CSC

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing. So far I have made Butter Pecan
customer_reviews.text: I do not write reviews much but had to here. After reviewing multiple ice cream makers I went with this one. This thing is amazing. So far I have made Butter Pecan, Banana Nut, Chocolate, and Pistachio almond ice cream. All organic with grass fed milks and butter, organic sweeter, Himalayan sea salt. No preservative ice cream that is out of this world. I still can not believe how good it is. Now all I have to do is watch the amount I eat and Ill be ok! My kids and wife love it. Win for quality, Win for price and Win for healthy ice cream.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: YOU GOT TO GET THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this is worth the money!!! My husband eats a pail of ice cream a week. He still only 110 lb. and almost 60. I love the fact that I don't have to buy ice or salt anymore... Like that you can set it and forget till it beeps. Then just freeze it and start making another batch. Sure beats going to the store. Very well packed. came on time and good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Vicker H

customer_reviews.title: Ice Cream Dream
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. We are still tweaking recipes, but have made some outstanding batches. We pre-chill the ice cream maker for 15 minutes and it really shortens the time for a batch. There is some noise while it runs, but not too bad. Ice cream and gelato are smooth and flavorful. Giving my grandchildren fresh treats and knowing exactly whats in it, is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, have used a handful of times in three months. Easy to clean except the nonremoveable seal between the unit and bucket but I use a toothpick for that. I have experimented with Ben and Jerry's ice cream book and the recipes come out well. It's been a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin E. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this machine, use it regularly. It's easy and the consistency is exactly right. A thick soft serve right when finished but freeze and it will harden like regular ice cream. Definitely lived up to my hopes and worth the cost. A tad noisier than ideal but not bad
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: We have made about a dozen batches in our unit and all turned out great. The unit is rather loud and it does ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want to keep trim don't get this. We have made about a dozen batches in our unit and all turned out great. The unit is rather loud and it does make a high-pitched squeal regularly. But you only have to put up with that for about 40 minutes, then you are done. One of our batches was so thick that the unit stopped rotating. We thought it was broken but it was not, it just stopped moving to protect itself I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Merk

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a dianetic and avoids any and all sugar and follow a low carb, high fat diet to control my glucose. So there are no ice creams I can buy at the store. With this I can enjoy ice cream with no sugar and no glycemic impact . It works great. An audible signal when it is done would be a nice additional feature.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Icecream maker
customer_reviews.text: Live this icecream maker. Its quick and easy when your making keto icecream. Really quiet for an icecream maker.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Best Ice Cream @ home and probably can win a pro contest
customer_reviews.text: My wife thought I overpaid for this. There are many other units way cheaper than this one. Its solid, heavy, strong but silent motor and gives some of the best ice cream you will taste. Let your imagination go... the family can come with some crazy mixes at times. No matter what, unless you go too crazy on flavors - I challenge you to find a commercial or artisan ice cream maker rivaling this little wonder. Its all 5 stars to our family
customer_reviews.author: Francobel

customer_reviews.title: It did not work
customer_reviews.text: It came damaged... the compressor does not work... it was exported to another country and when imI tried it, it did not worked... I already paid customs... now I have a big equipment that does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Julio Alonzo

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The machine works fine. It's a lot of fun to make your own ice cream . Making the batch to put in the machine has proven to be a challenge. But I'll keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: I'LL TAKE THIS AUTOMATIC MAKER TO THE HAND CRANK ANY DAY  NO MESS!!
customer_reviews.text: YAHOO!!!! This guy really works according to spec. Fairly quiet, holds a bit less than 1 1/2 quarts for freezing and makes a very tasty treat with no ice crystals. Just follow the operating instructions.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Makes great ice cream!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use one of the frozen canister models to make ice cream. My biggest issue with that one was that it wouldn't freeze the ice cream quick enough and tended to overchurn the ice cream (giving it a buttery texture which I didn't like). This unit works great - it's not too noisy and takes about 30-40 minutes to make ice cream. No overchurning - texture comes out great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: This machine does everything as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I didn’t buy this machine years ago. It has made gelato making a very pleasant experience. Even though most of the gelato recipes are made with cornstarch the flavor was still very good. I would recommend this product for anyone that wants ice cream or gelato fast and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S. Brenkus

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use. I was able to make delicious ice cream 60 mins.
customer_reviews.author: carolyf

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about this machine so far. I make dairy free ice cream. I mix up my ingredients in my vitamix pour in the bowl and 40-50 minutes later ice cream. Simple.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE TO USE
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT MAKES GREAST ICE CREAM IN 56 MIN. AND SIMPLE TO USE AND CLEAN.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bush

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs an ice cream machine!
customer_reviews.text: This makes it so easy to have low carb ice cream when you want it!
customer_reviews.author: Pam C

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: It's just perfect I will never buy icecream anymore. The steps were easy to follow
customer_reviews.author: jamgadet35

customer_reviews.title: Good golly this product works well
customer_reviews.text: Good golly this product works well. So fast... Bought a cheaper version that was slow, loud, and died young. This device has made gallons of ice cream without fail. We are super happy with it. Like all high-end Cuisinart products, it is a bit heavy. But the good news is that you can work off some of those calories getting it out and putting it away!
customer_reviews.author: Ronn Brashear

customer_reviews.title: It works great. Friends are still coming up with new recipe ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this ice cream maker for over a year. It works great. Friends are still coming up with new recipe ideas for me to try out. I haven't seen much difference in the final product between the gelato paddle and the ice cream one, but both work. Just be sure to cool the metal bowl before placing the mixture inside to get the best outcome. I simply run the machine a couple of minutes to do this. One can also put the bowl in a freezer.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun.
customer_reviews.text: Have to be careful not to get ice cream on freezing mechanism. There’s a gap and it’s hard to clean. Overall easy to use, though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Ice Cream
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing. Making ice cream is so easy we're doing a lot of it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Pre-Used? No Papers.
customer_reviews.text: It came looking pre-used on the machine and under the freezer bowl. And there were no instructions or information at all on how to use it, care for it, warranty info, nothing! Considering returning.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

product_meta.title: Cuisinart ICE-100 Compressor Ice Cream and Gelato Maker, Silver, 1-1/2-Quart
product_meta.description:
THE CUISINART COMPRESSOR ICE CREAM AND GELATO MAKER
The ICE-100 Ice Cream and Gelato Maker Make decadent ice cream, rich creamy gelato and light sorbet that your family will love, all in the comfort of your own home. The easy to use, fully automatic Cuisinart ICE-100 Ice Cream and Gelato Maker features a commercial-style compressor so you can make batch after batch without waiting. Two unique mixing paddles and a 60-minute countdown timer work to ensure your homemade gelato, ice cream or sorbet has the perfect consistency.

The included recipe book features a variety of flavors to create with the Cuisinart Ice Cream and Gelato Maker. You can also add in your favorite ingredients -- be it fresh fruits, chocolate chunks, even brownies -- during the mixing process through the see-through lid to make a fabulous frozen treat. Once the timer countdown is complete, the 10-minute Keep Cool cycle begins to keep your ice cream or gelato nice and cool. For optimum consistency, transfer the mixture to an airtight container and chill for a minimum of 2 hours.

Lid, mixing paddles, mixing bowl, and base FEATURES AND BENEFITS
Transparent Lid

Add recipe ingredients to the mixing bowl with the easily removable see-through lid and then watch the mixing process in action. 

Mix-in Opening

Use to add your favorite toppings and mix-ins, like chocolate chips or nuts, without interrupting the freezing cycle. 

Mixing Paddles

Two unique paddles mix and aerate the ingredients in the mixing bowl to create your frozen dessert. The gelato and sorbet paddle perfectly incorporates air in the ingredients and creates richly textured results with intense flavor. Use the ice cream paddle to perfectly churn for smooth, creamy results. 

Mixing Bowl with Lift-Out Handle

Anondized aluminum mixing bowl. No need to pre-chill or freeze the bowl prior to use. 

Touchpad Control Panel with LCD Readout

When the unit is on, the power button is illuminated by a red LED light. The countdown timer can be set from 10 minutes to 60 minutes. The Start/Stop button can be pressed at any point in the Mixing/Cooling cycle to pause the timer and mixing. The same button can be pressed to continue mixing.

MAKING FROZEN DESSERTS
 1. Use Cuisinart recipes included in the Instruction Booklet or use your own recipe, making sure your base does not go over the top dasher on the mixing paddle. Gelato and sorbet bases should be no more than 1 quart and ice cream bases should be no more than 5 cups. The ingredients will increase in volume during the freezing process. For best results, prepare the ingredients in a container from which it is easy to pour.
 2. Place the mixing bowl into the base.
 3. Place the ice cream or gelato/sorbet paddle in the mixing bowl so it rests in the center of the bowl.
 4. Pour ingredients into the mixing bowl.
 5. Press the Power button to turn the unit on and then set the timer per the recipe. The timer will default to 60 minutes.
 6. Press the Start/Stop button to begin the Mixing/Cooling cycle.
 7. Add ingredients such as chips and nuts towards the end of the mixing time once the mixture has begun to thicken.
 8. Once the set time concludes, the 10-minute Keep Cool cycle will keep your ice cream or gelato cool.
 9. When the frozen dessert is ready, transfer to a freezer-safe, airtight container for longer storage in the freezer.

ADDING INGREDIENTS
Ingredients such as chips and nuts should be added about five minutes before the freezing process is complete in order to fully incorporate them into the frozen mixture. To add a chocolate swirl to the mix, slowly drizzle in hot fudge or melted chocolate.
feature_bullets: Fully automatic with a commercial quality compressor. 1-1/2-quart ice cream bowl capacity
2 paddles - a gelato paddle for authentic gelato and an ice cream paddle for creamy ice cream
60-minute countdown timer with touchpad controls and a blue LCD readout.10-minute keep cool feature keeps your ice cream or gelato cool after timer has gone off

BPA Free Features: Fully automatic with a commercial quality compressor|1.5 quart capacity|2 paddles for authentic gelato and for creamy ice cream|60-minute countdown timer with touchpad controls and blue LCD readout|10-minute Keep Cool feature keeps your ice cream or gelato cool after the timer has gone off|BPA Free
